body_html:
Just a quick update on this, I "solved" my issue by recompiling tensorflow with changing the hardcoded parameters of the PoolAllocator. Just setting it to relatively high size and non-resizable allowed me not to run OutOfMemory.

See here

I suppose having it as a configuration parameter of the GPUOptions protobuf would probably be the best way of allowing this flexibility? Should I try to investigate this direction?

body:
Just a quick update on this, I "solved" my issue by recompiling tensorflow with changing the hardcoded parameters of the PoolAllocator. Just setting it to relatively high size and non-resizable allowed me not to run OutOfMemory.

See [here](https://github.com/SeguinBe/tensorflow/commit/2097a40d6ebfa3d4a690c5bb7592e8c433e6546e)

I suppose having it as a configuration parameter of the `GPUOptions` protobuf would probably be the best way of allowing this flexibility? Should I try to investigate this direction?
